quest.name: The Spice of Life
journal: Alphinaud is not one to be easily deterred.

Displaying an uncharacteristic lack of imagination, Alphinaud decides to continue questioning the people of the Brume, and bids you speak with Gibrillont in the meantime. Perhaps the proprietor of the Forgotten Knight will be more forthcoming than his customers.

In response to your inquiries about the Mongrel, Gibrillont stresses that discretion is key to running a successful tavern, making it all too clear that he will divulge no useful information. Before you can turn to leave, however, he offers to point you in the right direction in exchange for a small favor. Make your way to the Jeweled Crozier and collect a satchel of herbs from a hunter in Gibrillont's stead.
The hunter hands over the herbs with minimal fuss. Return to the Forgotten Knight and deliver them to Gibrillont.

Herbs in hand, the proprietor of the Forgotten Knight sets about preparing a batch of mulled wine. Few things stir the hearts of men so well, he says. If shared with the right people, what stories─and secrets─might spill from their lips?
objectives: Speak with the hulking hunter in the Pillars.
Deliver the fresh herbs to Gibrillont.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Frustrating though it may be, we must press on. While I continue speaking with the people of the Brume, why not go and see if Gibrillont knows aught of value?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As the proprietor of the Forgotten Knight, surely he must have heard whispers of the Mongrel before. We can only hope that he will be more forthcoming than the others.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: If you haven't yet, you should learn the Manderville art of parley. It's surprisingly effective─so long as you stick to topics you know well. For example, the other day I was discussing the copper ore market with this one gentleman...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I shall join you in the Forgotten Knight anon. There we can discuss our findings.

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: You know, people long for a sympathetic ear, but they need to know that it comes with tight lips.

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: Discretion, Forename─that's what my customers expect. If they don't get it, then I don't get them.

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: That being said, I'm not without my sympathies. I've heard the tales, and I know you've done right by highborn and lowborn alike.

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: Least I can do is point you in the right direction. But to do that, I'll need you to do something for me.

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: So happens there's a hunter up in the Crozier who owes me a fair bit of coin. However, I've agreed to accept payment in fresh herbs. Go and get them for me. Agreed?

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: Tell the hunter I sent you, and he should hand over the herbs without a fuss.

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: Come back here as soon as you have them. Simple as that.

dialogue.name: HUNTER01993
dialogue.text: So you're Gibrillont's errand girlboy? Good, good! How's he doing? Same as always? Right, right...

dialogue.name: HUNTER01993
dialogue.text: Anyroad, I hope he appreciates how much trouble I had to go through on account of his bloody herbs. Tell him to enjoy them while they last, because I doubt I'll be able to find any more next year.

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> Well? You going to hand them over or not?

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: Aye, this ought to do it. With a few other spices, I can make it just like she used to...

dialogue.name: GIBRILLONT
dialogue.text: There are few things which stir the hearts of men like a sip of mulled wine. Share a glass with the right people, and who knows what stories they'll share?
